section.heading: Grounds for liquidation.
section.text: The Commissioner may petition the Superior Court of the District of Columbia for an order directing him or her to liquidate a domestic insurer or an alien insurer domiciled in the District on the basis:

para.text: Of any ground for an order of rehabilitation as specified in § 31-1310, whether or not there has been a prior order directing the rehabilitation of the insurer;
That the insurer is insolvent; or
That the insurer is in such a condition that the further transaction of business would be hazardous, financially or otherwise, to its policyholders, its creditors, or the public.

annotations.annotation: This section is referenced in § 31-1314, § 31-1349, and § 31-3420.
Rehabilitation, liquidation, or conservation of health maintenance organizations, see § 31-3420.
